    $(function() {

        $('.flip_cases_front').on('click', function() {


            $(this).parent().parent().addClass('flip');
        });

        $('.flip_cases_back').on('click', function() {


            $(this).parent().parent().removeClass('flip');
        });
    });

<div class="row">
    <div class="col-md-8">
        <h3 id="countries">Confirmed Cases and Deaths by Country, Territory, or Conveyance</h3>
        <p>The <strong>coronavirus</strong> COVID-19 is affecting
      <strong>198 countries and territories</strong> around the world and <strong>1 international conveyance</strong> (the<em> Diamond Princess </em>cruise ship harbored in Yokohama, Japan). <strong>The day is reset after midnight GMT+0</strong>.<br/>
          <br/>
            <div style="margin-bottom:30px">
    <a style="text-decoration: underline;" href="/report_us/"><strong>Report coronavirus cases</strong></a>
</div>

<script>
    var tabs = ["today","yesterday"];
    $(document).ready(function() {

        tabs.forEach(function(val) {
            $('#main_table_countries_' + val).dataTable({

                "scrollCollapse": true,
                "scrollX": true,
                "order": [

                    [1, 'desc']
                ],
                "sDom": '<"bottom"flp><"clear">',
                "paging": false

            });

            $('#nav-' + val + '-tab a').click(function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();
                $(this).tab('show');
            })
        });
    });
</script>

	<li><strong>67 new&nbsp;cases</strong>, <strong>6&nbsp;new deaths</strong>, and <strong>401&nbsp;new discharges</strong> occurred in <strong>China</strong> on March 25, as reported by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China<strong>&nbsp;</strong>[<a href="http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqtb/202003/f01fc26a8a7b48debe194bd1277fdba3.shtml" target="_blank">source</a>]&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
    </div>    
</div></div><button style="margin-top:30px;" class="btn btn-light date-btn" data-date="2020-03-25">March 25 <i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-down"></i></button><div class="newsdate_div" style="display: none;" id="newsdate2020-03-25"><div class="news_post">
    <div class="news_body news_box">        
        <div style="border:1px solid #cccccc; padding:15px"><em>WHO Press Briefing</em>:<br />
<br />
&quot;We understand that countries are trying to assess <strong>when and how they will be able to ease these measures</strong>.<br />
<br />
The answer <strong>depends on what countries do</strong> while these population-wide measures are in place.<br />
<br />
Asking people to stay at home and shutting down population movement is <strong>buying time </strong>and reducing the pressure on health systems, but on their own, these measures<strong> will not extinguish the epidemics</strong>.<br />
<br />
The point of these actions is to enable the more precise and targeted measures that are needed to stop transmission and save lives. <strong>We call on all countries </strong>that have introduced so-called &quot;lockdown&quot; measures<strong> to use this time to attack the virus</strong>. You have created a second window of opportunity. The question is: how will you use it? There are <strong>6 key actions that we recommend</strong>:<br />
<br />
1.<strong> expand</strong>, train, and deploy your health care and <strong>public health workforce</strong><br />
<br />
2. implement a <strong>system to find every suspected case </strong>at the community level<br />
<br />
3. <strong>ramp up production capacity and availability of testing</strong><br />
<br />
4. identify, adapt, and equipt facilities you will use to <strong>treat patients</strong><br />
<br />
5. develop a clear plan and process to<strong> quarantine contacts</strong><br />
<br />
6. refocus the <strong>whole of government on suppressing</strong> and controlling COVID-19<br />
<br />
These measures are the best way to suppress and stop transmission so that when restrictions are lifted, the virus doesn&#39;t resurge.<br />
<br />
<strong>The last thing any country needs is to reopen schools and businesses only to be forced to close them again because of a resurgence</strong>&quot;&nbsp;<br />
<br />
<em>Dr.&nbsp;Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Director-General of WHO, March 25, 2020 [<a href="https://twitter.com/WHO/status/1242870976909459456" style="cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">video</a>]</em></div>
    </div>

        <ul class="news_ul"><li class="news_li"><strong>11 new cases</strong> in <strong>Qatar</strong>&nbsp;<span class="source">[<a class="news_source_a" target="_blank" href="https://thepeninsulaqatar.com/article/25/03/2020/11-new-COVID-19-cases-in-Qatar,-total-now-537">source</a>]</span></li></ul>
    </div>    
</div><div class="news_post">
    <div class="news_body">        
        <ul class="news_ul"><li class="news_li"><strong>5210 new cases</strong> and <strong>683 new deaths</strong> in <strong><a style="text-decoration: underline;" href="/coronavirus/country/italy/">Italy</a></strong>. <strong>4th day in a row with daily new cases below the 6557 peak&nbsp;reached on March 21</strong>. Protezione Civile chief Borrelli, the person usually holding the daily press conference, is at home with a fever, while the former chief Bertolaso is now hospitalized in Milan after having tested positive to the virus<br />
<br />
<span style="font-size:12px"><em>During the press conference, Protezione Civile officials were asked to clarify what the &quot;change in active cases&quot; (&quot;incremento delle persone attualmente positive&quot;) really represents, after our website&nbsp;had raised the issue of Italian media reporting the change in active cases (a lower number) rather than the change in total cases (a higher number), <strong>incorrectly representing it as &quot;newly infected&quot; </strong>when, in fact, it represents the <strong>&quot;change in active cases&quot; </strong><br />
<br />
<strong>Newly infected</strong>, meaning the number of people who have tested positive to the virus in the last day, <strong>corresponds to the number Worldometer has always reported</strong>, which is the <strong>change in total cases </strong>in accordance with the international standards set by the WHO and followed by all countries. An important figure which can be<a href="https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/country/italy/"> compared to newly recovered, as we do in our charts.</a><br />
<br />
The <strong>change in active cases </strong>(what most Italian media incorrectly label as &quot;newly infected&quot;) is the result of the <strong>following formula: (newly infected) - (new deaths) - (new recoveries)</strong>.<br />
<br />
Sharing the goal of providing the correct interpretation of data, we are pleased to notice that a few days ago, one of the leading Italian newspapers, Corriere della Sera, began reporting the figures correctly</em></span>&nbsp;<span class="source">[<a class="news_source_a" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/pcm-dpc/COVID-19/blob/master/dati-andamento-nazionale/dpc-covid19-ita-andamento-nazionale.csv">source</a>]</span>&nbsp;<span class="source">[<a class="news_source_a" target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a5r-XsD0KMw">source</a>]</span></li></ul>
    </div>    
</div><div class="news_post">
    <div class="news_body">

Despite <strong>not showing any symptoms </strong>of COVID-19, he was advised by health officials at the airport to <strong>go straight home and self-quarantine for 14 days</strong>. On Sunday night he developed a <strong>sore throat and then a cough</strong>. After resulting positive to the test, he and his family members were <strong>transported to the hospital with separate ambulances</strong>. Fiji Airways was practicing safe distancing by spacing out the 26 other passengers, who are now in self-quarantine. The airline had already announced they were cutting their international flights by 95%. Now they announced that, from tomorrow, there will be <strong>no more scheduled passenger Fiji Airways travel into or out of Fiji until further notice</strong>&nbsp;<span class="source">[<a class="news_source_a" target="_blank" href="https://www.fbcnews.com.fj/news/covid-19/fijis-fourth-covid-19-case-confirmed/">source</a>]</span></li></ul>

        <ul class="news_ul"><li class="news_li"><img alt="alert" src="/images/alert.png" style="width: 16px;"/>&nbsp;<strong>103 new cases</strong> and <strong>3 new deaths</strong> in <strong><a style="text-decoration: underline;" href="/coronavirus/country/india/">India</a></strong>. <strong>30 States</strong>/UTs (covering <strong>548 districts</strong>) announce <strong>complete lockdown</strong>.         <ul>
	<li><strong>39 new&nbsp;cases</strong>, <strong>9&nbsp;new deaths</strong> (all&nbsp;in Hubei), and <strong>459 new discharges</strong> occurred in <strong>China</strong> on March 22, as reported by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China. For the 5th day in a row, <strong>no new confirmed or suspected cases</strong> have been reported in<strong> Wuhan</strong> and in&nbsp;<strong>Hubei&nbsp;</strong>[<a href="http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqtb/202003/fbd8871d80574991a4913cd180f83402.shtml" style="cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">source</a>]&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
    </div>    
</div></div><button style="margin-top:30px;" class="btn btn-light date-btn" data-date="2020-03-22">March 22 <i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-down"></i></button><div class="newsdate_div" style="display: none;" id="newsdate2020-03-22"><div class="news_post">
    <div class="news_body news_box">        
        <div style="border:1px solid #cccccc; padding:15px"><strong>After nearly 2 months</strong>, <strong>Wuhan</strong> (the epicenter of the pandemic in China) <strong>announced today that it would be loosening the lockdown </strong>by gradually resuming public transportation and allowing healthy people to go back to work. [<a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-china/china-scrambles-to-curb-rise-in-imported-coronavirus-cases-wuhan-eases-lockdown-idUSKBN21903C" style="cursor: pointer;">source</a>]<br />
<br />
China had put Wuhan and other cities into <strong>lockdown on Jan. 23&nbsp;</strong>when a<strong> total of 25 deaths</strong> had been reported in the country. <strong>After about 3 weeks </strong>of lockdown, the number of <strong>new&nbsp;deaths reached its peak</strong> in China&nbsp;[<a href="/coronavirus/country/china/" style="cursor: pointer;">see graphs</a>] and then began declining.<br />
<br />
<strong>Italy </strong>went into a similar<strong> lockdown</strong> on March 11, when<strong> 827 deaths </strong>had already been reported, and<strong>&nbsp;8 days after</strong> reaching <strong>79 deaths</strong>&nbsp;(March 3)&nbsp; [<a href="/coronavirus/country/italy/" style="cursor: pointer;">see graphs</a>]&nbsp;&nbsp;and <strong>19 days after the beginning of the outbreak in the country</strong>&nbsp;(Feb. 21)&nbsp;[<a href="/coronavirus/feb-2020-news-updates-covid19/" style="cursor: pointer;">see archived news</a>]&nbsp; On Feb. 22, Italy <strong>had become the country with the highest number of cases among all non-Asian nations</strong>.&nbsp; [<a href="/coronavirus/feb-2020-news-updates-covid19/" style="cursor: pointer;">see archived news</a>]&nbsp;<br />
<br />
<strong>When China reached a similar number of deaths </strong>(811 deaths on Feb. 8)&nbsp;<strong>the lockdown </strong><strong>had already been implemented for&nbsp;&nbsp;2 weeks</strong>.<br />
<br />
The&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/who-china-joint-mission-on-covid-19-final-report.pdf" style="cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">Report of the WHO-China Joint Mission</a></strong> noted that by rolling out &quot;perhaps the<strong> most ambitious, agile and aggressive disease containment effort in history</strong>&quot; China &quot;<strong>has changed the course</strong> of a rapidly escalating and deadly epidemic&quot; and that the<strong> remarkable speed</strong> with which Chinese scientists and public health experts isolated the causative virus, established diagnostic tools, and determined key transmission parameters, such as the route of spread and incubation period, provided the vital evidence base for China&rsquo;s strategy.&nbsp;[<a href="https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/who-china-joint-mission-on-covid-19-final-report.pdf" style="cursor: pointer;">source</a>]</div>
    </div>    
</div><div class="news_post">
    <div class="news_body">

    <div class="news_body">        
        <ul class="news_ul"><li class="news_li"><img alt="alert" src="/images/alert.png" style="width: 16px;"/>&nbsp;<strong>5588 new cases</strong> and <strong>49 new deaths</strong> in <strong><a style="text-decoration: underline;" href="/coronavirus/country/us/">the United States</a></strong>.<strong> 23% of the US Population is ordered to &quot;stay at home&quot;</strong>&nbsp;after governors in <strong>California</strong> (40 million residents),&nbsp;<strong>New York State</strong> (20 million), <strong>Illinois</strong> (13 million), and <strong>Connecticut </strong>(3.5 million)&nbsp;ordered nonessential workers to remain at home to slow the spread of coronavirus.
<ul><br />
	<li><strong>Connecticut </strong>issues a &quot;<strong>stay at home</strong>&quot; order for its 3.5 million residents that goes into effect Monday at 8 p.m</li>
	<li><strong>Texas </strong>declared a <strong>public health disaster </strong>for the <strong>first time in more than 100 years&nbsp;</strong> [<a href="https://www.fox32chicago.com/news/pritzker-issues-stay-at-home-order-to-illinois-residents" style="cursor: pointer;">source</a>]&nbsp;</li>
	<li><strong>Illinois:</strong> Governor Pritzker issues an immediate<strong> &quot;stay at home&quot; order for all residents</strong> &quot;<em>to avoid the loss of potentially tens of thousands of lives</em>&quot; The order goes into effect at 5 p.m. Saturday. [<a href="https://www.fox32chicago.com/news/pritzker-issues-stay-at-home-order-to-illinois-residents" style="cursor: pointer;">source</a>]&nbsp;</li>
	<li><strong>New York:&nbsp;</strong>Governor Cuomo orders 100% of all <strong>non-essential workers to stay home&nbsp;</strong> [<a href="https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/coronavirus/nyc-hospitals-weeks-from-running-out-of-supplies-as-death-toll-soars/2335762/" style="cursor: pointer;">source</a>]</li>
	<li><strong>Pennsylvania:</strong>&nbsp;Governor Wolf orders<strong> all businesses that aren&rsquo;t &lsquo;life-sustaining&rsquo; to close</strong> [<a href="https://www.governor.pa.gov/newsroom/all-non-life-sustaining-businesses-in-pennsylvania-to-close-physical-locations-as-of-8-pm-today-to-slow-spread-of-covid-19/" style="cursor: pointer;">source</a>]</li>
	<li><strong>California</strong>:&nbsp;Governor Gavin Newson orders the state&rsquo;s <strong>40 million residents to &ldquo;stay at home</strong>.&rdquo; The order is &ldquo;<strong>open ended</strong>.&rdquo; Modeling predicts tha<strong>t 56% of the state&rsquo;s population will be infected over the next 8&nbsp;weeks.</strong> Only essential businesses will be allowed to remain open. &nbsp;All indoor public and private gatherings with 10 or more people are prohibited [<a href="https://news.trust.org/item/20200320015813-olc40" style="cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">source</a>]&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />

    <div class="news_body news_box">        
        <ul>
	<li><strong>Italy</strong>: in the city of Bergamo, there were <strong>108 more deaths</strong> in the first 15 days of March this year compared to 2019&nbsp;(164 deaths in 2020 vs. 56 deaths in 2019) according to the mayor of the city&nbsp;Giorgio Gori. During this period, <strong>31 deaths </strong>were attributed to the <strong>coronavirus </strong>(<strong>less than 30%</strong> <strong>of the additional deaths this year</strong>)&nbsp;<br />
	<br />
	&quot;<em>There are <strong>significant numbers of people who have died but whose death hasn&#39;t been attributed to the coronavirus</strong> because they died at home or in a nursing home and so they weren&#39;t swabbed</em>,&quot; said the mayor&nbsp;<span class="source">[<a class="news_source_a" target="_blank" href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-italy-homes-insigh/uncounted-among-coronavirus-victims-deaths-sweep-through-italys-nursing-homes-idUSKBN2152V0">source</a>]</span></li>

</ul>
<span style="font-size:12px"><em>Due to the wrong number being posted on the&nbsp;<strong><a href="http://www.salute.gov.it/nuovocoronavirus">Official Italian Health Ministry website</a></strong> (Total Cases number was,<strong> and still is</strong>, posted under the Active Cases label) we were showing incorrect data for a brief moment until we fixed the error. We have now removed that website from our list of reliable sources</em></span></li></ul>

        }

            animation: lds-ellipsis1 0.6s infinite;

            left: 8px;
            animation: lds-ellipsis2 0.6s infinite;
        }


        .lds-ellipsis div:nth-child(3) {
            left: 32px;
            animation: lds-ellipsis2 0.6s infinite;
        }

            left: 56px;
            animation: lds-ellipsis3 0.6s infinite;

                transform: scale(0);
            }


            100% {
                transform: scale(1);
            }
        }

                transform: scale(1);
            }


            100% {
                transform: scale(0);
            }
        }

    <script type="text/javascript">
        $(document).ready(function() {

            if ($('.news_post').length <= 0) {

                $('#news').hide();

            }

            $(document).on('click', '.load-more__btn', function() {


                var ID = $(this).attr('id');
                var country = $(this).attr('data-country');
                var region = $(this).attr('data-region');
                var days_count = $(this).attr('data-days_count');


                $('.load-more__btn').hide();
                $('.loading').css('display', 'inline-block');
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'POST',
                    url: '/coronavirus/news-block/news_main.php',
                    data: 'fd=' + ID + (country ? '&country=' + country : '') + (region ? '&region=' + region : '') + (days_count ? '&days_count=' + days_count : ''),
                    success: function(html) {
                            $(ID).remove();
                            $('.loading').remove();
                            $('#news_block').append(html);


                            dateButtonsEvents();


                        }


                        ,
                    error: function(objAJAXRequest, strError) {
                        $('.loading').remove();
                        $('.load-more__btn').show();
                    }
                });
            });
        });

        function dateButtonsEvents() {


            $('.date-btn').prop("onclick", null).off("click");
            $('.date-btn').on('click', function() {


                var n = $('#newsdate' + $(this).data('date'));
                if (n.is(':visible')) {
                    n.slideUp('fast');
                    $(this).find('i').removeClass('fa-chevron-circle-up');
                    $(this).find('i').addClass('fa-chevron-circle-down');
                } else {
                    n.slideDown('fast');


                    $(this).find('i').removeClass('fa-chevron-circle-down');
                    $(this).find('i').addClass('fa-chevron-circle-up');
                }
            });


        }
        $(document).ready(function() {



            dateButtonsEvents();
        });
    </script>
  <div  align="center" style="margin-top:40px; margin-bottom:40px; font-size:20px; padding:20px; background-color: #efefef"><em>Archived</em>:<br>
    <br><a href="/coronavirus/feb-2020-news-updates-covid19/">
  February 2020 Coronavirus News Updates</a></div> 


<div style="margin-top:40px; margin-bottom:40px; text-align:center">
<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<!-- wm-vertical -->
<ins class="adsbygoogle"
     style="display:block"
     data-ad-client="ca-pub-3701697624350410"

     data-ad-format="auto"
     data-full-width-responsive="true"></ins>

     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

</div>
			
			
<p><strong>January Timeline:</strong></p>

            <ul>
              <li>On January 31, the first 2 novel coronavirus cases in the UK, <sup>[<a href="#ref-18">18</a>]</sup> the first 2 cases in Russia, <sup>[<a href="#ref-20">20</a>]</sup> and the first case in Sweden and in Spain were reported. Canada reported its 4<sup>th</sup> case.</li>

                <li>On Jan. 31, the United States

                    <ul>

                        <li><a href="https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2020/01/31/secretary-azar-declares-public-health-emergency-us-2019-novel-coronavirus.html">declared Coronavirus a Public Health Emergency</a></li>

                        <li>issued <strong>14 days quarantine</strong> rules for US citizens entering the US from China (mandatory if entering from the Hubei province).</li>

                        <li> issued an order to <strong>deny entry to foreigners </strong>who have traveled to China within the past two weeks.</li>

                    </ul>





                <li>On January 30, the novel coronavirus total case count surpassed that for SARS (which affected 8,096 people worldwide).</li>

                <li>On January 30, the World Health Organization declared the coronavirus outbreak a <strong>Global Public Health Emergency</strong>. </li>

                <li>On January 30 CDC confirmed the first US case of human to human transmission<sup>[<a href="#ref-17">17</a>]</sup>. </li>

                <li>Germany, Japan, Vietnam and the United States have reported cases in patients who didn't personally visit China, but contracted the virus from someone else who had visited Wuhan, China<sup>[<a href="#ref-15">15</a>]</sup>. These cases of human to human transmission are the most worrisome, according to the WHO<sup>[<a href="#ref-16">16</a>]</sup>.</li>

                <li>Wuhan (the city where the virus originated) is the largest city in Central China, with a population of over 11 million people. The city, on January 23, shut down transport links. Following Wuhan lock down, the city of Huanggang was also placed in quarantine, and the city of Ezhou closed its train stations. This means than 18 million people have been placed in isolation. The World Health Organization (WHO) said cutting off a city as large as Wuhan is &quot;unprecedented in public health history.&quot;<strong><sup>[<a href="#ref-12">12</a>] </sup></strong> and praised China for its incredible commitment to isolate the virus and minimize the spread to other countries. </li>

            </ul>

            <div align="left">

                <h2>How dangerous is the virus?

                </h2>

                <p>There are three parameters to understand in order to assess the magnitude of the risk posed by this novel coronavirus: </p>

                <ul>

                    <li><a href="#repro">Transmission Rate (<strong>Ro</strong>)</a> - number of newly infected people from a single case</li>

                    <li><a href="/coronavirus/coronavirus-death-rate/">Case Fatality Rate (CFR)</a> - percent of cases that result in death </li>

                    <li>Determine whether <a href="/coronavirus/coronavirus-incubation-period/#asy">asymptomatic transmission </a>is possible</li>

                </ul>

                <h2 id="repro">How contagious is the Wuhan Coronavirus? (Ro) </h2>

                <p>The <em>attack rate</em> or <em>transmissibility</em> (how rapidly the disease spreads) of a virus is indicated by its reproductive number (Ro, pronounced <em>R-nought</em> or <em>r-zero</em>), which represents the average number of people to which a single infected person will transmit the virus.</p>

                <p>WHO's estimated (on Jan. 23) Ro to be between 1.4 and 2.5. <sup>[<a href="#ref-13">13</a>]</sup></p>

                <p>Other studies have estimated a Ro between 3.6 and 4.0, and between 2.24 to 3.58. <sup>[<a href="#ref-23">23</a>]</sup>. </p>

                <p>Preliminary studies had estimated Ro to be between <strong>1.5 and 3.5.</strong> <sup>[<a href="#ref-5">5</a>][<a href="#ref-6">6</a>][<a href="#ref-7">7</a>]</sup></p>

                <p>An outbreak with a reproductive number of below 1 will gradually disappear.</p>

                <p>For comparison, the Ro for the common flu is 1.3 and for SARS it was 2.0.</p>

                <h2 id="fata">Fatality Rate (<em>case fatality ratio</em> or <em>CFR</em>) of the Wuhan Coronavirus</h2>

                <p><em>See full details: <a href="/coronavirus/coronavirus-death-rate/"><strong>Coronavirus Fatality Rate</strong></a></em></p>

                <p>The novel coronavirus' case <strong>fatality rate</strong> has been estimated at around <strong>2%</strong>, in the WHO press conference held on January 29, 2020 <sup>[<a href="#ref-16">16</a>]</sup> . However, it noted that, without knowing how many were infected, it was too early to be able to put a percentage on the mortality rate figure.</p>

                <p> A prior estimate <strong><sup>[<a href="#ref-9">9</a>]</sup></strong> had put that number at 3%. </p>

                <p>Fatality rate can change as a virus can mutate, according to epidemiologists.</p>

                <p>For comparison, the case fatality rate for SARS was 10%, and for MERS 34%.</p>

                <h2 id="incubation">Incubation Period (how long it takes for symptoms to appear) </h2>

                <p><em>See full details: <a href="/coronavirus/coronavirus-incubation-period/"><strong>COVID-19 Coronavirus Incubation Period </strong></a></em></p>

                <p>Symptoms of COVID-19 may appear in as few as 2 days or as long as 14 (estimated ranges vary from 2-10 days, 2-14 days, and 10-14 days, <a href="/coronavirus/coronavirus-incubation-period/">see details</a>), during which the virus is contagious but the patient does not display any symptom (<em>asymptomatic transmission</em>).</p>

                <h2 id="age">Age and conditions of Coronavirus cases </h2>

                <p><em><img src="../img/alert-plus.png" width="16" height="16"> See latest findings: <a href="/coronavirus/coronavirus-age-sex-demographics/"><strong>Age, Sex, Demographics of COVID-19 Cases and Deaths </strong></a></em></p>

                <p>According to early estimates by China's National Health Commission (NHC), about 80% of those who died were over the age of 60 and 75% of them had

                    pre-existing health conditions such as cardiovascular diseases and

                    diabetes.<sup>[<a href="#ref-24">24</a>]</sup></p>

                <p>According to the <a href="https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/situation-reports/20200127-sitrep-7-2019--ncov.pdf">WHO Situation Report no. 7</a> issued on Jan. 27:

                </p>

                <ul style="margin-top:30px">

                    <li>The median age of <strong>cases </strong>detected <strong>outside </strong>of China is 45 years, ranging from 2 to 74 years.</li>

                    <li> 71% of cases were male.</li>

                </ul>

                <p>A study of 138 hospitalized patients with NCIP found that the median age was 56 years (interquartile range, 42-68; range, 22-92 years) and 75 (54.3%) were men.<sup>[<a href="#ref-25">25</a>]</sup> </p>

                <p>The WHO, in its <a href="https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public/myth-busters">Myth busters FAQs</a>, addresses the question: <em>&quot;Does the new coronavirus affect older people, or are younger people also susceptible?&quot; </em>by answering that: </p>

                <ul>

                    <li><strong>People of all ages can be infected </strong>by the novel coronavirus COVID-19. </li>

                    <li><strong>Older people</strong>, and people with<strong> pre-existing medical conditions</strong> (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease) appear to be <strong>more vulnerable to becoming severely ill</strong> with the virus.</li>

                </ul>

                <h4> Patient who died in the Philippines was a 44-year old male</h4>

                The patient who died in the Philippines on February 2, in what was the first death occurring outside of China, was a 44-year-old Chinese man from Wuhan who was admitted on Jan. 25 after experiencing fever, cough, and sore throat, before developing severe pneumonia. In the last few days, “the patient was stable and showed signs of improvement, however, the condition of the patient deteriorated within his last 24 hours resulting in his demise.&quot;

                according to the Philippine Department of Health.

                <h4>Serious Cases of 30 year old patients in France </h4>

                <p>



                    As of Jan. 29, according to French authorities, the conditions of the two earliest Paris cases had worsened and the patients were being treated in intensive care, according to French authorities. The patients have been described as a young couple aged <strong>30 and 31 years old</strong>, both Chinese citizens from Wuhan who were asymptomatic when they arrived in Paris on January 18 <sup>[<a href="#ref-19">19</a>]</sup>.</p>

                <h4><strong>Age and Sex of the first deaths as reported by the China National Health Commission (NHC) </strong></h4>

                <p> The NHC reported the details of the first 17 deaths up to 24 pm on January 22, 2020. The deaths included 13 males and 4 females. The median age of the deaths was 75 (range 48-89) years.<sup>[<a href="#ref-21">21</a>]</sup></p>

                <h2>WHO Risk Assessment: Global Emergency</h2>

                <p><em>See full details: <a href="/coronavirus/who-coronavirus/"><strong>WHO coronavirus updates</strong></a></em></p>

                <p>On January 30, the World Health Organization declared the coronavirus outbreak a Global Public Health Emergency.</p>

                <p>For more information from the WHO regarding novel coronavirus: <em><a href="https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019">WHO page on Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)</a> </em></p>

            </div>


<div style="margin-top:40px; margin-bottom:40px; text-align:center">
<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>

     style="display:block"

     data-ad-format="auto"
     data-full-width-responsive="true"></ins>

     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

</div>



        <h2 align="left">Comparisons:<br>

        </h2>

        <div align="left">

            <ul>

                <li>Every year an estimated 290,000 to 650,000 people die in the world due to complications from seasonal influenza (flu) viruses. This figure corresponds to 795 to 1,781 deaths per day due to the seasonal flu. </li>

                <li>SARS (November 2002 to July 2003): was a coronavirus that originated from Beijing, China, spread to 29 countries, and resulted in 8,096 people infected with 774 deaths (fatality rate of 9.6%). Considering that SARS ended up infecting 5,237 people in mainland China, Wuhan Coronavirus surpassed SARS on January 29, 2020, when Chinese officials confirmed 5,974 cases of the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV). One day later, on January 30, 2020 the novel coronavirus cases surpassed even the 8,096 cases worldwide which were the final SARS count in 2003.</li>

                <li>MERS (in 2012) killed 858 people out of the 2,494 infected (fatality rate of 34.4%).</li>

            </ul>

        </div>

        .modal.modal-fullscreen {

            margin: 0;
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%
        }

            border: none;
            border-radius: 0;
            box-shadow: none;
            position: absolute;
            top: 0;
            bottom: 0;
            left: 0;
            right: 0;
            overflow: hidden
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-header {
            position: absolute;
            left: 0;
            right: 0;
            top: 0;

            border-color: #e7e7e7
        }

            display: inline-block;
            line-height: 50px;
            position: absolute
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-header .btn {
            vertical-align: top;
            height: 50px
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-header .btn .glyphicon {
            font-size: 22px
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-header .close {
            display: none
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-header .fullscreen-buttons {
            position: relative;
            z-index: 1;
            background-color: #f8f8f8;
            height: calc(49px)
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-body {
            position: absolute;
            top: 50px;
            left: 0;
            right: 0;
            bottom: 0;
            overflow: scroll;
            padding: 7px
        }

        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-footer {
            display: none
        }
    }

    @media (min-width:992px) {
        .modal.modal-fullscreen .modal-dialog .modal-content .modal-header .btn {
            display: none
        }
    }

    .antispam {

        display: none;
    }

    .case_number {

        display: inline-block;

        /*-moz-appearance: textfield;
        -webkit-appearance: none;
        margin: 0;*/
    }

    input::-webkit-outer-spin-button,
    input::-webkit-inner-spin-button {
        /* display: none; <- Crashes Chrome on hover */
        -webkit-appearance: none;
        margin: 0;
        /* <-- Apparently some margin are still there even though it's hidden */
    }

    input[type=number] {
        -moz-appearance: textfield;
        /* Firefox */
    }

        max-height: calc(100vh);
        max-width: calc(100vw);
        overflow-y: auto;

<script>
    $(function() {
        var t = 0;
        $("body").on("show.bs.modal", ".modal.modal-fullscreen", function() {
            var a, o = $(this),
                n = o.find('.modal-footer .btn:not([data-dismiss="modal"])');
            o.find(".modal-header .pull-right, .modal-header [data-additional-close]").remove(), $('<div class="pull-right fullscreen-buttons">').prependTo(o.find(".modal-header")), $.each(n, function() {
                var a, n = t++,
                    d = $(this),
                    l = d.data("glyphicon"),
                    e = d.data("faicon"),
                    i = d.data("mobileText") || d.text();
                $(this).attr("data-button-tag", n), l || e ? (a = $("<button>").attr("title", i).attr("data-toggle", "tooltip").attr("data-placement", "bottom"), l && $('<i class="glyphicon ' + l + '">').appendTo(a), e && $('<i class="fa fa-2x ' + e + '">').appendTo(a)) : a = $("<button>").text(i), a.addClass("btn btn-link").attr("data-button-tag", n).appendTo(o.find(".modal-header .fullscreen-buttons:last")), (l || e) && a.tooltip()
            }), $('<button class="btn btn-link btn-lg" type="button" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close" data-additional-close>').prependTo(o.find(".modal-header")), $('<i class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left">').prependTo(o.find(".modal-header button:first")), history.pushState(null, null, null), a = function() {
                o.data("hidden-by-back", !0), o.modal("hide")
            }, $(window).one("popstate.fs-modal", a), o.one("hide.bs.modal", function() {
                $(window).off(".fs-modal", a), o.data("hidden-by-back") || history.back(), o.data("hidden-by-back", null)
            })
        }), $("body").on("click", ".modal-header .fullscreen-buttons .btn-link", function(t) {
            var a = $(this),
                o = a.data("buttonTag");
            a.parents(".modal-content").find(".modal-footer").find('[data-button-tag="' + o + '"]').click()
        })
    });
    $(document).ready(function() {

        if (window.location.href.indexOf('#contactModalForm') != -1) {
            $('#contactModalForm').modal('show');
        }


        $('#countries_select').selectize({
            persist: false,
            labelField: 'entity_medium',
            valueField: 'cca3',
            searchField: [
                'cca3', 'entity_name', 'entity_name_list', 'entity_name_title', 'entity', 'entity_veryshort', 'entity_simple', 'entity_medium', 'entity_long', 'entity_alphabet', 'entity_short_article', 'entity_medium_article', 'entity_long_article', 'synonyms'
            ],
            options: countries_options

        });

        $("a[href='/contact/']").after('| <a href="/report_us/">report coronavirus cases</a>');

        $("a[href='/report_us/']").on('click', function() {


            $('#contactModalForm').modal('show');
            return false;
        });


    });
</script>

            <div class="modal-body">
                <p class="statusMsg"></p>
                <form role="form" id="contactForm" action="contact_submit.php">

                    <input type="hidden" name="contact_form" value="1" />

                        <div class="form-group">
                            <label for="email" class="form_labels">Your email (optional):</label>

                    </div>

                        <label for="total_cases" class="form_labels">Total Cases:</label>

                    </div>-->

                        <label for="url" class="form_labels">Source URL (where to verify values):</label>

                        <p class="antispam"><input name="url2" /></p>

<!-- confirm modal -->
<div class="modal" id="contactModalFormConfirm" tabindex="-1" role="dialog">
    <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
            <!-- Modal Header -->
            <div class="modal-header">
                <button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="modal">
                    <span aria-hidden="true">&times;</span>
                    <span class="sr-only">Close</span>
                </button>
                <h4 class="modal-title">Check before sending:</h4>
            </div>

            <!-- Modal Body -->

                <div id="confirmation_page">

                    <div id="confirm_email"></div>
                    <div id="confirm_country"></div>
                    <div id="confirm_new_cases"></div>
                    <div id="confirm_total_cases"></div>
                    <div id="confirm_url"></div>
                    <div id="confirm_message"></div>
                </div>
            </div>

            <!-- Modal Footer -->
            <div class="modal-footer">
                <button type="button" class="btn btn-default" onclick="backToContactForm(event)">No, back to form</button>
                <button type="button" class="btn btn-primary submitBtn" onclick="submitContactForm(event)">Yes, SEND</button>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

<script src="/js/selectize.min.js" defer></script>

<script>
    function validateEmail(email) {
        var re = /^(([^<>()[\]\\.,;:\s@\"]+(\.[^<>()[\]\\.,;:\s@\"]+)*)|(\".+\"))@((\[[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\])|(([a-zA-Z\-0-9]+\.)+[a-zA-Z]{2,}))$/;
        return re.test(email);
    }

    function scrollIntoViewIfNeeded(target) {
        var rect = target.getBoundingClientRect();
        if (rect.bottom > window.innerHeight) {
            target.scrollIntoView(false);
        }
        if (rect.top < 0) {
            target.scrollIntoView();
        }
    }

    function showErrorMessage(msg) {
        scrollIntoViewIfNeeded($(".statusMsg")[0]);
        $('.statusMsg').html('<span style="color:red;">' + msg + '</span>').fadeOut(200).fadeIn(200);
    }

    function showConfirmForm(e) {

        var form = $('#contactForm');

        var all_empty = true;

        if (form.find('#countries_select option:selected').text() != '') {


            all_empty = false;
            $('#confirm_country').html('<strong>Country: </strong>' + form.find('#countries_select option:selected').text());
        } else {

            showErrorMessage('"Country" field is required');
            return false;
            $('#confirm_country').html('');
        }

        if (form.find('#new_cases').val() != '') {
            all_empty = false;
            $('#confirm_new_cases').html('<strong>New Cases: </strong>' + form.find('#new_cases').val());
        } else {
            $('#confirm_new_cases').html('');
        }

        if (form.find('#total_cases').val() != '') {
            all_empty = false;
            $('#confirm_total_cases').html('<strong>Total Cases: </strong>' + form.find('#total_cases').val());
        } else {
            $('#confirm_total_cases').html('');
        }

        if (form.find('#email').val() != '') {

            if (!validateEmail(form.find('#email').val())) {

                showErrorMessage('Bad email address format, please fix');
                return false;

            }

            all_empty = false;
            $('#confirm_email').html('<strong>Email: </strong>' + form.find('#email').val());
        } else {
            $('#confirm_email').html('');
        }

        if (form.find('#url').val() != '') {
            all_empty = false;

            $('#confirm_url').html('<strong>URL: </strong>' + form.find('#url').val());
        } else {
            showErrorMessage('"Source URL" field is required');
            return false;

            $('#confirm_url').html('');
        }

        if (form.find('#message').val() != '') {
            all_empty = false;
            $('#confirm_message').html('<strong>Comment: </strong>' + form.find('#message').val());
        } else {
            $('#confirm_message').html('');
        }


        e.preventDefault();
        $('#contactModalForm').modal('hide');
        $('#contactModalFormConfirm').modal('show');


    }

    function backToContactForm(e) {

        e.preventDefault();
        $('#contactModalFormConfirm').modal('hide');
        $('#contactModalForm').modal('show');

    }

    function submitContactForm(e) {
        var re = /^[0-9]*$/i;
        var new_cases = $('#new_cases').val();
        var total_cases = $('#total_cases').val();



        if (!re.test(new_cases)) {
            alert('New cases should have numbers only.');
            new_cases.focus();
            return false;
        } else if (!re.test(total_cases)) {
            alert('Total cases should have numbers only.');
            total_cases.focus();
            return false;
        }

        e.preventDefault();

        var form = $('#contactForm');
        var url = form.attr('action');

        $.ajax({
            type: "POST",
            url: url,
            data: form.serialize(),
            success: function(data) {


                $('#contactModalFormConfirm').modal('hide');
                alert('Thank you');

            }
        });



    }
</script>        </div>

        <!-- RIGHT -->
        </div><div class="col-md-4 adright">

		 style="display:inline-block;width:300px;height:600px"
		 data-ad-client="ca-pub-3701697624350410"
		 data-ad-slot="2348228155"></ins>
	<script>
	(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
	</script>

    (function() {
        function async_load(script_url){
            var protocol = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://');
            var s = document.createElement('script'); s.src = protocol + script_url;
            var x = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; x.parentNode.insertBefore(s, x);
        }
        bm_website_code = '7849CD9451D34931';
        jQuery(document).ready(function(){async_load('asset.pagefair.com/measure.min.js')});
        jQuery(document).ready(function(){async_load('asset.pagefair.net/ads.min.js')});
    })();
</script>
